column1: Plan for Hardware Aspects of Certification

column2: Test
PHAC.DOC
Project Manager
Checklist Item
Have the test results been verified with independence?
Does the SDD describe the data and control flow of the design?

Is Field Loadable Software thoroughly planned (including safety-related requirements at the system level that specify failure/restore procedures that default appropriately upon detection of a corrupted or inappropriate SW load; the loading function includes error detection of inappropriate configurations)?
Do all test cases trace to/from test procedures?
Does the SVP include a description of the how Local Type consistency will be verified?
Does the software development environment chosen limit the opportunity for introducing errors?
Has the Tool Qualification Plan been controlled under configuration management category CC2?
Within the PSAC, have the Impact Levels based on defined criteria (i.e., Criteria 1, 2 or 3) been identified and justified for each tool?
Have derived high-level requirements and their reasons for existence been defined?
Does the HDD include a list of unused functions in selected components and actions taken to assure they will not compromise the safety of the hardware item?
Have the results been subjected to appropriate change and configuration control (HC2)?
Does the PHAC or HDP describe the process for documenting the requirements (including derived requirements) related to the correct control and use of the allocated COTS IP unused functions?
Do the requirements trace upward to the next hierarchical level according to the criteria defined in the plan?
In the HDL code, are all active low signals identified and justified (since they should only be used if there is a compelling reason to do so)?
Has problem reporting been established for all verification and design-related items?
Have requirements-related baselines and traceability been established?
Does the Trace Data demonstrate a bi-directional associations between low-level requirements and high-level requirements?
Have the planned transition criteria for entering the Test for Credit as identified in the PSAC and Software Verification Plan been satisfied?

Has a process for providing data between the software and hardware life cycle process (including derived requirements, HW/SW integration, protocols, timing constraints, interface schemes and incompatibilities) been identified?
Has a SOI-1 audit been held, and have certification authorities agreed on the means of compliance and that it is acceptable to move into development?
Have the results of the verification activities been documented?

Have configuration items (including hardware, design representations of hardware, tools or other data items used for certification credit and baselines) been uniquely identified, documented and controlled?
